segments.text: Ugh, that overflowing sink is making such a gross mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's pouring everywhere, soaking the cabinets and floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's standing in it, her shoe all wet—nasty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just drying that plate, ignoring the filth spreading.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those dishes on the counter might get splashed too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids—climbing for cookies in this slop?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's in the puddle; it'll slip right out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy's hand in the jar, probably getting crumbs everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching too—hands will be sticky and dirty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Secret cookie theft on a wet floor? Revolting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a clean garden, but inside it's a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand how sloppy this whole thing is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Turn off the faucet before it's unbearable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just too messy for words.
segments.speaker: PAR
